creditline: Gift of Various Donors, by exchange
description: swivel TV picture tube with tan plastic backing attached to a red and white metal console on a stand with black plastic bottom shelf and chrome legs
text: Although this design, with the tube atop the cabinet, was already popular in France and Italy, Philco came up with the Princess model, utilizing more cutting-edge technology, for the American market.  With the Princess, the tube is several inches shorter than the earlier European models and allows for shallower depth and a more streamlined silhouette. The innovative, freestanding Princess, with its prominent television tube, allowed it to be viewed as an element of industrial design rather than as a piece of furniture.  Although it helped rejuvenate the American TV industry, the mechanics proved to be unreliable.
title: Predicta "Princess" television
